newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russia's TSUM to sell shares Oct 1.
newsitem.headline: Russia's TSUM to sell shares Oct 1.

text.p: Russian retailer AO Torgovy Dom TSUM will issue 30 million ordinary shares with a face value fo 1,000 roubles each on October 1, the manager of the issue IK Olma said on Monday.
The issue, whose price will be announced on October 1, will raise authorised capital by 30 billion roubles from 59 billion.
Proceeds from the issue will go towards the refurbishment of TSUM's central Moscow buildings in time for the city's 850th anniversary next year.
The total value of the project, which will also expand TSUM's floorspace, is $22 million, Olma said.
Igor Grossman, head of Olma's equities department, said the new share would not have a negative impact on TSUM's share price, which remained well bid.
"We can see interest from several major institutional investors, so I think a large amount of these shares simply won't get to the secondary market," he told Reuters.
TSUM was last traded on the Russian Trading System on September 13 at $0.29. It was quoted on Monday at $0.27/0.35.
